noun.description: A joining or merging of different parts or qualities in which the component elements are individually distinct.
examples: this color combination is stunningly effective
a combination of blackberries, raspberries, and rhubarb

noun.description: A sequence of numbers or letters used to open a combination lock.
A selection of a given number of elements from a larger number without regard to their arrangement.

origin: Late Middle English: from late Latin combinatio(n-), from the verb combinare join two by two (see combine).
